alert.note: Alert for Breathitt; Floyd; Knott; Magoffin; Martin; Pike (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued January 01 at 7:51AM EST until January 01 at 11:45AM EST by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... South Central Martin County in northeastern Kentucky... East Central Breathitt County in southeastern Kentucky... Central Floyd County in southeastern Kentucky... Northern Knott County in southeastern Kentucky... Southeastern Magoffin County in southeastern Kentucky... Northern Pike County in southeastern Kentucky... * Until 1145 AM EST. * At 751 AM EST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1.5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Pikeville, Prestonsburg, Coal Run Village, Martin, Forest Hills, Wayland, Allen, Boldman, Betsy Layne, Justell, Harold, Coal Run, Aluba, Gulnare, Ivel, Osborn, Grethel, McCombs, Honaker and Dana. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

area.areaDesc: Breathitt; Floyd; Knott; Magoffin; Martin; Pike
